meanings.definition: To fasten or join one thing to another
meanings.sent1: I attach the paper to the wall with tape.
meanings.sent2: Please attach the document to your email before sending it.
meanings.sent3: He tried to attach his shoelaces to his ears, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Her smile seemed to attach a sense of warmth to the room.
meanings.sent5: The magnet was able to attach the key to the refrigerator.

meanings.sent1: I attach great importance to spending time with family.
meanings.sent2: It's easy to attach to a character in a good book.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she could attach her feelings to a pet rock.
meanings.sent4: Their shared love for music seemed to attach them instantly.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt letter really managed to attach to my emotions.

meanings.definition: To include or add as an attachment
meanings.sent1: Don't forget to attach the file to the email.
meanings.sent2: The email includes a photo attached to the bottom.
meanings.sent3: He tried to attach a banana peel to his phone, just for fun.
meanings.sent4: The extra pages were attached to the back of the book.
meanings.sent5: Make sure to attach all the necessary documents to the application.

meanings.definition: To assign or attribute to something
meanings.sent1: They attach great importance to punctuality in this company.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, people attach specific meanings to certain colors.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly tried to attach his bad luck to a broken mirror.
meanings.sent4: The artist's signature was attached to the bottom corner of the painting.
meanings.sent5: She always manages to attach positivity to every situation.
